The thing I don't get is why does derpibooru resize avatars to exactly 125x125?  That doesn't make sense.  If you want a gif avatar it either has to be a square or have a larger boundary than the image that you shrink after done editing.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5340bad06368725794e00200#post_5340bad06368725794e00200
That's how avatars have always ben, They have to be at that Ratio, I don't think I've seen a single site with Flexible avi sizes (That No one has abused by making absurdly huge avis)
topics.author: 5062d6f17f123b3e16001184

topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5340bb816368723a712c0200#post_5340bb816368723a712c0200
It's not that hard actually.  Just have it to where if it's larger than the size it gets scaled proportionally, but if it's under than justify it left top inside of a 125x125 table that size so as to avoid any potential clipping.

"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5340bb816368723a712c0200#post_5340bb816368723a712c0200
[bq="trashboat"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5340bad06368725794e00200#post_5340bad06368725794e00200
That No one has abused by making absurdly huge avis[/bq]
<-- One of those people

What's fun to do also on certain websites, like art websites, have your signature or avatar as a hyperlink to automatically adding you to the person's watch list, follow list or such.  I've gotten banned from sites before for doing that.
